name: Dragunov SVD
description: A semi-automatic rifle developed to replace the mosin-nagant as the designated marksman rifle of the Soviet Union in the 1960's.

name: SVT-40
description: A semi-automatic rifle intended to replace the mosin-nagant as the main service rifle of the Soviet Red Army.  While the out break of WWII disrupted production over a million were still built before production ceased in favor of the SKS after the war.

name: PKM
description: The PKM is a belt-feed 7.62x54mmR general-purpose machine gun developed in the Soviet Union.  It is still widely used by the Russian army as well as many other countries.

name: Pecheneg
description: The PKP Pecheneg is a belt-feed 7.62x54mmR general-purpose machine gun developed to replace the Soviet era PKM.  It features a heavier barrel and mounts for optics or other sights.

name: Obrez
description: A Mosin-Nagant rifle that has had it's barrel and stock sawed down to make a crude pistol sized weapon.  Popular among criminals and irregular forces as concealable firearm when handguns are unavailable.
